    • Estimating Animal Density Using Camera Data

Estimating Animal Density Using Camera Data

Source: vignettes/working_with_abmi_camera_data_in_R.Rmd
working_with_abmi_camera_data_in_R.Rmd

Working with ABMI Camera data in R

library(abmi.camera.extras)

Generate density estimates for an area of interest

ABMI camera data can be used to generate species-specific density estimates for a variety of species in a given area of interest. First, we subset the ABMI camera deployments by the specified area of interest (e.g. a Wildlife Management Unit; Municipality; etc).

In this example we use a sample of four WMUs - Crow Lake (code 512), Lac La Biche (503), Beaver River (502), and Amisk (504) - all of which are located in the central-east part of Alberta.

library(sf)
#> Linking to GEOS 3.8.0, GDAL 3.0.4, PROJ 6.3.1

# aoi
wmu_sample <- st_read(system.file("extdata/wmu_sample.shp", package = "abmi.camera.extras"))
#> Reading layer `wmu_sample' from data source `C:\Users\mabec\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpoxQSJ8\temp_libpath38982fa534db\abmi.camera.extras\extdata\wmu_sample.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
#> Simple feature collection with 4 features and 5 fields
#> geometry type:  POLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: 632139.5 ymin: 5997019 xmax: 776266.6 ymax: 6209376
#> projected CRS:  NAD83 / Alberta 10-TM (Forest)

# Find deployments in aoi
wmu_sample_deployments <- ace_get_cam(wmu_sample, group_id = WMUNIT_NAM)
#> although coordinates are longitude/latitude, st_intersects assumes that they are planar
#> although coordinates are longitude/latitude, st_intersects assumes that they are planar

From here we can join density estimates for a species of interest in a given year for each deployment.

# Join density
df_density <- ace_join_dens(wmu_sample_deployments, species = c("Moose", "White-tailed Deer"), nest = FALSE)

Next, we estimate the density of each species within each WMU.

df_density_summary <- ace_summarise_dens(df_density,
                                         group_id = WMUNIT_NAM,
                                         agg_samp_per = FALSE,
                                         conflevel = 0.9)
#> Warning: The `add` argument of `group_by()` is deprecated as of dplyr 1.0.0.
#> Please use the `.add` argument instead.
#> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.
#> Call `lifecycle::last_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated.

df_density_summary
#> # A tibble: 22 x 9
#> # Groups:   WMUNIT_NAM, samp_per, common_name [22]
#>    WMUNIT_NAM samp_per common_name occupied n_deployments prop_occupied
#>    <fct>         <dbl> <chr>          <int>         <int>         <dbl>
#>  1 Amisk          2014 Moose              4             4         1    
#>  2 Amisk          2014 White-tail~        4             4         1    
#>  3 Amisk          2018 Moose              6            15         0.4  
#>  4 Amisk          2018 White-tail~       11            15         0.733
#>  5 Beaver Ri~     2016 Moose              6            21         0.286
#>  6 Beaver Ri~     2016 White-tail~       17            21         0.810
#>  7 Beaver Ri~     2017 Moose              4             4         1    
#>  8 Beaver Ri~     2017 White-tail~        4             4         1    
#>  9 Beaver Ri~     2018 Moose              6             9         0.667
#> 10 Beaver Ri~     2018 White-tail~        6             9         0.667
#> # ... with 12 more rows, and 3 more variables: density_avg <dbl>,
#> #   density_lci_0.9 <dbl>, density_uci_0.9 <dbl>
